item.title: 中国阿里巴巴将通过发行可转换债券融资 45 亿美元
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股公司周四表示，将出售 45 亿美元的可转换优先票据，并计划使用部分收益回购美国存托股票。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding said on Thursday it would sell $4.5 billion in convertible senior notes and plans to repurchase American Depositary Shares using some of the proceeds.】

item.title: 消息人士称，信实和迪斯尼寻求印度反垄断点头，并保证板球版权
item.description: 两位直接知情人士告诉路透社，信实工业公司和华特迪斯尼公司已为其 85 亿美元的印度媒体合并案申请反垄断许可，理由是双方的综合实力，尤其是在板球转播方面的综合实力，不会对广告商造成冲击。【原文：Reliance Industries and Walt Disney have sought antitrust clearance for their $8.5 billion India media merger by arguing their combined power, especially on cricket broadcasting, will not hit advertisers, two people with direct knowledge told Reuters.】

item.title: 日本央行上田坚持经济复苏观点，保留加息机会
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周四表示，日本经济正处于温和复苏的轨道上，并暗示仅凭第一季度国内生产总值（GDP）的下滑不会阻止央行在未来几个月内加息。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Thursday the economy was on track for a moderate recovery, suggesting a slump in first-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) alone would not keep the central bank from raising interest rates in coming months.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利执行董事长詹姆斯-戈尔曼将于年底卸任
item.description: 摩根士丹利执行董事长詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）在该行年度股东大会上表示，他将于 12 月 31 日卸任。【原文：Morgan Stanley's executive chairman James Gorman will step down on Dec. 31, he told the bank's annual shareholder meeting.】

item.title: 报告显示，美国 5 月汽车销量将小幅增长
item.description: 据行业咨询公司J.D. Power和GlobalData周四联合发布的报告称，受跨界SUV和皮卡需求的推动，预计5月份美国新车销量将环比增长。【原文：New vehicle sales in the United States are projected to rise in May from a year earlier, helped by demand for crossover SUVs and pickup trucks, according to a joint report by industry consultants J.D. Power and GlobalData on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降，劳动力市场保持稳健
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量有所下降，这表明劳动力市场的基本实力应能继续支撑经济。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell last week, pointing to underlying strength in the labor market that should continue to support the economy.】

item.title: 民意调查 全球股市牛市疲态尽显，但预计不会出现回调
item.description: 路透社对股票分析师进行的一项调查显示，全球股市牛市正在显现出疲态，大多数主要股指预计不会重现去年的辉煌表现，这些分析师还表示，近期不太可能出现回调。【原文：The global equity bull run is showing signs of fatigue, with most major stock indexes not expected to repeat last year's stellar performance, according to a Reuters poll of stock analysts who also said a near-term correction was unlikely.】

item.title: 拉尔夫-劳伦任命 Justin Picicci 为首席财务官，预计年收入将下滑
item.description: 拉尔夫-劳伦（Ralph Lauren）周四预测年度收入增长低于市场预期，并任命 Justin Picicci 接替 Jane Nielsen 担任首席财务官。【原文：Ralph Lauren on Thursday forecast annual revenue growth below market expectations and named Justin Picicci as its chief financial officer succeeding Jane Nielsen.】

item.title: 更多投资者涌入新兴市场，掩盖了新兴市场资金外流的事实
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）的一位资深经济学家告诉路透社记者，大资金投资者开始将更多现金投放到新兴市场，因为他们追求回报，这可能是他们资金分配方式的结构性转变。【原文：Big-money investors are beginning to place more cash in emerging markets as they chase returns in what could be a structural shift in the way they allocate their money, a veteran Bank of America economist told Reuters.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋预计人工智能生成的视频将推动对其芯片的更多需求
item.description: 对于芯片设计公司英伟达（Nvidia）来说，人工智能的蓬勃发展是一份源源不断的礼物。【原文：For chip designer Nvidia , the generative artificial intelligence boom is the gift that keeps on giving.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局称波音公司在安全问题上面临 "漫长道路
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）局长周四表示，美国飞机制造商波音公司在解决安全问题方面面临着 "漫长的道路"，该局正准备接受波音公司解决安全问题的计划。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing faces a "long road" to address safety issues, the head of the Federal Aviation Administration said on Thursday as it prepares to receive the company's plan to address concerns.】

item.title: 古墓丽影》的所有者说，随着人工智能的发展，人类是游戏进化的关键
item.description: 古墓丽影》特许经营权所有者 Embracer 公司首席执行官周四告诉路透社，人工智能已成为游戏领域的一个重要工具，但人类的创造力对于开发游戏仍然至关重要。【原文：AI has become a major tool in gaming, but human creativity remains crucial to developing games, the CEO of Tomb Raider franchise owner Embracer told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 美敦力季度利润超预期，医疗设备表现强劲
item.description: 周四，医疗技术公司美敦力的季度利润和收入均超出华尔街预期，原因是大流行病后医院手术量的回升促进了对其医疗设备的需求。【原文：Health tech firm Medtronic beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and revenue on Thursday, as a post-pandemic pickup in surgical volumes at hospitals boosted demand for its medical devices.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车制造商需要时间而非关税来抵御中国竞争
item.description: 欧洲汽车业高管在路透社的一次活动中表示，欧洲的汽车巨头没有太多时间来重组其业务和产品线，以与崛起的中国汽车制造商竞争，而更严厉的关税对保护现状几乎没有作用。【原文：Europe's car giants won't have much time to restructure their operations and product lines to compete with ascendant Chinese automakers, and stiffer tariffs will do little to protect the status quo, industry executives said during a Reuters event.】

item.title: 全球经济 商业活动改善令降息成疑
item.description: 周四的调查显示，本月全球企业业绩普遍有所改善，亚洲和欧洲部分地区的企业活动有所回升，这为各国央行可能推迟降息提供了空间。【原文：Businesses across the globe broadly enjoyed an improved performance this month with activity picking up across parts of Asia and Europe, surveys showed on Thursday, giving central banks room to potentially defer cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 道明银行因国内银行业务和财富管理业务强劲而实现季度利润增长
item.description: 道明银行集团周四公布第二季度利润增长，主要得益于其国内个人和商业银行业务以及财富管理部门的强劲表现。【原文：TD Bank Group reported a rise in its second-quarter profit on Thursday driven by strong performance of its domestic personal and commercial banking and wealth management units.】

item.title: 起亚摆脱电动汽车需求放缓的影响，推出紧凑型电动 SUV
item.description: 起亚公司周四推出了该公司基于其专用电动汽车平台打造的首款紧凑型电动运动型多用途车，并打赌即使在全球电动汽车市场发展势头停滞不前的情况下，该公司也能通过具有竞争力的价格赢得买家的青睐。【原文：Kia Corp launched on Thursday the company's first compact electric sports utility vehicle built on its dedicated EV platform, betting it can win over buyers through competitive pricing even as momentum in the global EV market stalls.】

item.title: 谷歌收购 HubSpot 将增强挑战微软的实力
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 可能收购市值 310 亿美元的美国营销软件制造商 HubSpot，这将增强谷歌在向企业提供基于云的应用程序方面与微软竞争的能力。【原文：Google parent Alphabet's potential acquisition of HubSpot , a U.S. marketing software maker with a market value of $31 billion, would boost its ability to compete against Microsoft in offering cloud-based applications to companies.】

item.title: 华尔街为加快贸易结算做好准备
item.description: 美国交易周二将改用较短的结算时间，监管机构希望这将降低全球最大市场的风险并提高效率，但预计会暂时增加投资者的交易失败率。【原文：U.S. trading moves to a shorter settlement on Tuesday, which regulators hope will reduce risk and improve efficiency in the world's largest markets, but is expected to temporarily increase transaction failure for investors.】

item.title: 早间新闻英伟达击败美联储，台湾和英国民调紧张
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 斯嘉丽-约翰逊与 OpenAI 的恩怨重新点燃了好莱坞对人工智能的恐惧
item.description: 高管们告诉路透社，OpenAI明显向电影《她》致敬，并配上了斯嘉丽-约翰逊（Scarlett Johansson）的声音，这正在引发整个好莱坞对人工智能的反弹。【原文：OpenAI's apparent homage to the movie "Her" featuring the voice likeness of Scarlett Johansson is fueling a backlash against artificial intelligence across Hollywood, executives told Reuters.】

item.title: 米莱如何开启阿根廷的铜矿财富？修复经济
item.description: 阿根廷对其安第斯北部尚未开发的铜矿资源雄心勃勃。阿根廷希望成为全球前十大铜生产国，并吸引了嘉能可（Glencore）、伦丁矿业（Lundin Mining）和第一量子矿业（First Quantum Minerals）等投资者。【原文：Argentina has big ambitions for the untapped copper riches in its Andean north. It wants to be a top 10 global producer and has attracted investors such as Glencore , Lundin Mining and First Quantum Minerals .】

item.title: 小米第一季度营收增长 27%，智能手机销售强劲
item.description: 中国电子产品制造商小米周四公布，受智能手机市场复苏带动手机销售强劲的提振，第一季度营收增长27%，增幅高于预期。【原文：Chinese electronics maker Xiaomi posted a bigger-than-expected 27% rise in first-quarter revenue on Thursday, boosted by strong sales of handsets amid a recovery in the smartphone market.】

item.title: 英伟达助推芯片股反弹，纳斯达克和标普 500 指数期货大涨
item.description: 周四，在英伟达（Nvidia）乐观的收入预期巩固了投资者对人工智能技术飞速发展的乐观情绪后，芯片类股大涨，导致科技股重仓股纳斯达克指数（Nasdaq）和基准股S&P 500指数（S&P 500）的期货价格攀升。【原文：Futures tracking the tech-heavy Nasdaq and the benchmark S&P 500 climbed on Thursday as chip stocks rallied after Nvidia's upbeat revenue forecast cemented investor optimism around the meteoric rise of artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 监管机构称中国推动公司分红应吸引投资
item.description: 中国一位高级监管者周四表示，政府鼓励企业多分红的政策应能增加中国股市对海外投资者的吸引力。【原文：Government policies to encourage companies to pay more dividends should increase the attractiveness of China's stock market for overseas investors, a senior Chinese regulator said on Thursday.】

item.title: 高盛挑选内部人士共同管理德国和奥地利的投资银行业务
item.description: 路透社在周四看到的一份备忘录中称，美国顶级银行之一高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）已选择在该行工作的延斯-霍夫曼（Jens Hofmann）和蒂博尔-科萨（Tibor Kossa）担任其德国和奥地利投资银行业务的新联席主管。【原文：Goldman Sachs has chosen Jens Hofmann and Tibor Kossa, both working for the bank, as new co-heads of its Germany and Austria investment banking business, one of the top U.S. banks said in a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国万科获得 28 亿美元在岸银团贷款额度
item.description: 资金紧张的大型房地产开发商中国万科周四表示，该公司已获得200亿元（27.6亿美元）银团贷款，并将继续推进其他融资，以增加流动资金。【原文：Cash-strapped major property developer China Vanke said on Thursday it had received a 20 billion yuan ($2.76 billion) syndicated loan facility and it would continue to push forward other financing to boost its liquidity.】

item.title: 耶伦称七国集团将讨论应对中国工业产能过剩的措施
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周四表示，七国集团（G7）财长将讨论他们对中国工业产能过剩的担忧和可能的应对措施，并补充说，如果中国政府不改变政策，他们的经济将受到大量廉价中国商品的冲击。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday that G7 finance ministers will discuss their concerns about China's excess industrial capacity and potential responses, adding that without policy changes in Beijing their economies will be hit with a flood of cheap Chinese goods.】

item.title: 蒙代尔兹公司因跨境贸易限制被欧盟罚款 3.657 亿欧元
item.description: 奥利奥制造商蒙代尔兹国际公司周四被欧盟反垄断监管机构处以 3.375 亿欧元（3.6572 亿美元）的罚款，理由是妨碍欧盟国家之间巧克力、饼干和咖啡产品的跨境贸易。【原文：Oreo maker Mondelez International was fined 337.5 million euros ($365.72 million) by EU antitrust regulators on Thursday for impeding cross-border trade of chocolate, biscuits and coffee products between EU countries.】

item.title: 美国计划向 Absolics 提供 7500 万美元赠款，用于先进芯片封装
item.description: 美国商务部周四表示，计划向 Absolics 公司拨款 7500 万美元，用于在佐治亚州建造一座占地 12 万平方英尺的工厂，该工厂将向美国半导体行业供应先进材料。【原文：The US Commerce Department said on Thursday it plans to grant $75 million to Absolics for constructing a 120,000-square-foot facility in Georgia that will supply advanced materials to the country's semiconductor industry.】
